titleStmt.title: The disloyal actings of the Bermuda Company in London by their keeeping [sic] back a petition presented (from the General Assembly in the said islands, convented together there, according to the laws of the said company) to the Kings Most Excellent Majesty. With several grievances, petitions, and papers; as will more at large appear in the following narrative, shewing the great oppressions the poor inhabitants in the said islands do groan under, by the arbitrary government of the Somer-Islands Company: in all humility presented to the honourable, the knights, citizens, and burgesses assembled in Parliament, craving from them to be relieved from the aforesaid and following oppressions / by William Righton.
titleStmt.author: Righton, William.
Bermuda Islands. House of Assembly.
